website_summaries.verdict: For a step up in photo quality or performance from a phone or compact, the Canon EOS Rebel T7i/800D remains a fan favorite.
pros: The Canon EOS Rebel T7i/800D delivers reasonable photo and video quality and respectable performance in a time-tested body
cons: Relatively large compared to other cameras in its class and its photos aren't as sharp as competitors'

customer_reviews.title: I love the results to date and I am passing on ...
customer_reviews.text: The improvements (features) in this body make it worth the price, plus all my prior lenses work extremely well with this camera. Pictures are slightly sharper and colors are slightly more bright. I love the results to date and I am passing on my older EOS Rebel bodies to my children/grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: Readmore

customer_reviews.title: Love the camera
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a big upgrade from my t5 but holy cow this camera is insane. I can do anything with this camera and it's perfect for beginners through experts. Love the camera
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Young

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Rebel T5 to this Canon Rebel T7i and love it. Vast improvement on photo quality. Fast focus, good colors and easy to use. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Easy to Use and just overall a great product!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great! I only need the body since I had a previous camera with lenses already. The WiFi feature on this camera is super easy to download your pictures on a computer or even your cellphone! I love cannons products and they are easy to use. If you're looking for a new camera this would be the one I recommend. I use it for sports pictures and have to say the speed on the shutter is fantastic! Thank you so much for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Denise H.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for an amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: I am IN LOVE with this camera. Amazing quality. I had a Rebel T2i and finally upgraded. Such a change, but easy to learn because it's a similar body. I love being able to shoot in RAW and the LCD screen that you can move. One of my favorite things about this camera is being able to use high speed continuous shooting in so many different modes.
customer_reviews.author: *J*

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Finally got an upgrade and I'm so glad I did. The Canon Rebel T7i takes great pictures and is a great addition to what I currently have. The camera looks new and came with a new strap, battery, battery pack, and 64 gig memory card which I was pleasantly surprised to receive since it didn't say anything about the memory card. The best part was that whoever tested the camera took pictures and never deleted them so I had a good laugh at all the butt pics on it lol!! Overall I am extremely satisfied with what I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Love the WiFi and Bluetooth!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my wife as an upgrade from her Nikon D5200 and she absolutely loves it! One thing she was really looking for was the WiFi and Bluetooth connectivity. This camera works flawlessly in that department, as well as takes excellent photos.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Clear upgrade from earlier models
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional photographer, but I have been taking sports/family photos with a Canon Rebel XTi for almost 15 years. This camera is a solid upgrade. I have not read the user manual yet, but I am finding the settings on this camera quite complicated. This could be due to skipping forward so many generations in this series, but I would not call this a beginner camera unless you're pretty tech savvy. I'm 32, so not completely outside the realm of the computer. There are just so, so many menus and settings and options. It's a lot. But I've used the wifi to download photos, and that is a great feature I never had before!
customer_reviews.author: Klarissa

customer_reviews.title: Great camera if you're looking for an upgrade
customer_reviews.text: After months of researching I decided to go with the Canon Rebel T7i. I started out using the Cannon T3 then got the T6 a few years later. Both cameras were great. But as my skills got better I felt like I needed to upgrade. It was the right choice! It's very user-friendly and takes phenomenal pictures. So if you're like me and love photography, I highly recommend this camera. I also called Canon to make sure my old lenses would fit and they did. Cannon had great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Scott

customer_reviews.title: It is a Champ.
customer_reviews.text: I did a extended reserch for this camera and others and this is a real good camera it will mach the 80D but is a smaller version , same sensor same dual pixels it all come down to the sensors in the cameras even the same sensor like in a Mark cameras.%100
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Takes much sharper pictures than my old Canon T3i and feels substantial. Well made, easy to use, and leaving it on automatic for casual shooting still produces great pics. Can't wait to learn more and use it to its full potential. Paired it with a really nice lens.
customer_reviews.author: Net Tech

customer_reviews.title: Great camera only one flaw
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this camera for a few months now, and I really enjoy it. I have been using it for mostly youtube videos so far. The only thing I don't like is that it stops recording every 30 minutes, but it doesn't bother me enough to replace it. I will probably use this camera untill it starts to fall apart, because I like it so much. The mic that came in this set is pretty decent as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brinkbabe9`

customer_reviews.title: Forget the flash
customer_reviews.text: A very nice camera with a lot of small improvements compared to my 10-year-old Canon. The one really big difference is the huge improvement in low-light performance. I no longer have much use for a flash. If I can see what I want to shoot, the camera can get a pretty good shot of it with ISO up to 25600. In fact, my one small annoyance is that portrait mode comes up with the flash enabled by default, so you have to manually turn that off each time. That gets old quickly. I would rather just have the flash stay off unless I push the button to pop it open. Otherwise, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I am a new photo bug, and after doing a lot of research I decided to go with this camera, and I am so glad I did! Its extremely easy to use, but has advance functions as well so it grows with the user's journey. I have had this for many months now, and have not had a single problem with it. The screen that pops out and turns around has been extremely useful when taking self portrait shots!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Trombley

customer_reviews.title: Clarity is Super Sharp & Auto Focus Like  a Champ
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera. It's excellent. Great quality and clarity. I use it mostly to film for my YouTube channel but I also take amateur photos. Previously I used the T5 and it's like literal night and day. I'm really glad I upgraded. The auto focus alone more than pays for it. Im still figuring out a lot of the spec but it's been relatively easy to navigate. The rode microphone is great as well. Fairly sensitive mic. I was filming in my living room and you could very clearly hear my daughter laughing at me from the kitchen. But of course if you film in a more controlled area the sound is beyond excellent.
customer_reviews.author: ReallyS4Real

customer_reviews.title: Great for low cost video
customer_reviews.text: We use these cameras for most of our video work. I use a full frame camera for pictures - but for low cost (under 1000) dollars, the video is amazing. Don't expect perfection in low-light, but when doing two point interviews, it is a GREAT option. Probably the best auto focus (facial recognition) under 1000 dollars for video. Canon is a household name for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this to replace my beat up T3i & I love it! Was very easy to transition from the older model to the new!
customer_reviews.author: Cjac

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with the T7i
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed the ease of use, downloading by wifi, and the camera being so lightweight. The photo quality is crisp and clear. I went from a Canon 40D to this T7i and couldn't be happier with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: JOANN H

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera it is great and takes amazing pictures it is really worth the value and it is lightweight and just a really good camera. You can download the app on your smartphone and It connects trough Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Gyða Sif

customer_reviews.title: Best camera- HANDS DOWN- there is no other!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old (like 10+ year old) Rebel. I started really wanted to do photography and so after I shot my first wedding I decided to get a better camera; invest in my business. BEST DECISION EVER. This camera is absolutely amazing. The shutter speed is unbelievable and it’s a great camera. I gave it 4 stars for “beginner” because this has so many different settings that it could be confusing. Overall o wouldn’t recommend any other camera.
customer_reviews.author: lmlacy14

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am using the T7i for astrophotography and it produces amazing pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: I’m a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research. And was going toward the next model up. Stepped down to this model for being a better choice for a beginner. I think I made a perfect choice for me, or any beginner. They call it the best camera under a 1000.00... I agree w them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Brady

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise the camera has lots of good features and made use of T6I for a few ...
customer_reviews.text: It might have been the lens but the focusing on this camera is somewhat imprecise compared to Nikon. It had difficulty in low light situations and didn't seem to find faces in portrait type of shots. Something that remedial should be no brainer. Otherwise the camera has lots of good features and made use of T6I for a few years. Just felt this was not much of improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Larry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I moved from Nikon to Canon and holy crap am I happy I did. I'm a beginner and this is so much easier to use and the picture quality seems to be a ton better. I'm still learning how to use it in it's full capacity but so far I'm in love!
customer_reviews.author: Erika Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and takes great videos and pictures
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera based off of reviews and the fact that it was a Cannon. I am no photographer by a long shot but I must admit that this camera was very easy to use and self explanatory as far as operation goes. I purchased solely for videoing and I love it. I know it can be daunting buying something so expensive, especially if your not sure what you are purchasing. This is the camera!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera With Many Features
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera to 'get back in to photography'. Have some experience but dated. Pretty complicated for a 'beginner' camera. Nice to have auto modes though. I just need to do some work on some features that interest me. The manual has such small font that it is difficult to read without a magnifying glass. Suggest Canon supply 2 manuals, English and Spanish and larger font.
customer_reviews.author: Joe McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Vacation Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I love the form factor, not too big, not too small, and not too heavy, yet it can compete with many of the other pricey DSLR on the market. I took it for a spin during my recent vacation and I was not disappointed. If it had a headphone jack that would allow me to listen as I recorded video it would have gotten 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: DaQuez B. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera, very happy. Buy the rubber housing for it won't fit snug they just don't but I promise you will never take it off. The T7 is a crop camera you dont need to go full frame trust me. But if you do, buy EF lenses for it, they are for crop or full, do your research. No fancy water resistant housing or rubber seals so keep it dry.
customer_reviews.author: wes henriksen

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and customer service is top-notch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as I'm trying to get into astrophotography. I haven't actually taken any pics yet as I'm waiting to receive the lens tomorrow. Despite this, the camera seems to work fine physically. It gave me a battery error around the third time I turned it on. I emailed Ian at Southtown Camera and he shipped a new battery to me today. I haven't received the battery yet, but the customer service is great! I highly recommend this seller. Thanks Ian and Southtown Camera!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing camera. Simple enough for our 14 year old to figure out how to use as well. I wouldn’t think twice on getting this, just do it.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money, easy to use/learn,Bluetooth/Wi-Fi, touch screen,not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera! Easy to use but plenty to learn. I'm no professional photographer by any means but have been told I take some professional pictures. I'll take some of the credit but this camera is the star of the show! If this camera is missing anything a real "professional photographer" would point out I'm sure they would also point out it makes up for it with all the features it does have. If your looking to step up your game this is definitely the camera if this is in your price range. Not durable as the high price but quality pictures like one
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second DSLR camera and the T7i fits our needs perfectly as a family. I love working with manual and traditional settings and my husband prefers preset/automatic options and this camera has both settings. Also, the high ISO options made it possible to take pictures in less well lit circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Katie L

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase/investment
customer_reviews.text: First camera I've bought, really easy to use. I've only been using the lens that comes with it. I haven't had the need not time to use it at low light/night settings, but so far I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AdmiralFoxy

customer_reviews.title: Great Service. No problems and excellent transfer.
customer_reviews.text: Product was exactly as described. Arrived on time in great condition without any damage to packaging or notable defects on the camera body. The package came with the camera body, strap, battery and charger, and a instruction manual. Everything is in working condition and the camera is great.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: I love Canon
customer_reviews.text: I have prior experience with a Canon Rebel XT and a little experience with a Canon Rebel T3i, and honestly the buttons and controls and everything are largely the same, just an improvement with technology with later models. I don't regret purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Alayna

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC CAMERA! Microphone.... eh.
customer_reviews.text: This camera DEFINITELY raised my production quality on YouTube! The AF is perfect, the photography is AMAZING, and my absolutely favorite camera to work with via photography. My only issue is the random static the Rode microphone has after only using it four times. I'm looking into it now (since it only started happening today), but I really wished it would have lasted longer before an issue like this popped up. The microphone is the only reason this product doesn't have five stars! It's worth buying JUST for the camera, you guys! Just be prepared with another boom microphone for longterm use.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: picture quality is worse on digic 7 dslr
customer_reviews.text: let me explain i tired every setting on this camera i had a camera class by a professional so i know about exposer , iso and aperture your going to get better results with a rebel t6 the color reproduction is better on that digic 4 processor then you will with this buy a t6 anyday i highly recommend unless i got a lemon
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the t3i for seven years and I upgraded to this one. I’m very pleased with the quality and ease with this camera. The pictures are very clear and I’m in love with being able to transfer straight from my camera to my phone. I’ve only had a couple weeks to use this so I’m just beginning to discover what it’s all about.
customer_reviews.author: Serra Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I are beginners in the photography world. Just a couple photography classes between us. We love this camera. It produces amazing pictures and it is super lightweight and not a burden to take with us all day on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Salva

customer_reviews.title: Canon EOS REBEL T7i Body
customer_reviews.text: great deal from this seller. the rebel camera produces stunning nighttime astrophotography shots
customer_reviews.author: Prestidigitation

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for Vlog and Podcast
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my YouTube and podcast "Stuff I Heard". The sound and picture quality is great. It's easy to use. It will stop recoding video at 30 minutes and I have to restart it when recording long form podcast videos.
customer_reviews.author: Deloris Peek

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: Even the lens that comes with is surprisingly great. I expected it to be crap but this whole bundle is amazing. Surpassed my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Emily McCall

customer_reviews.title: A great camera
customer_reviews.text: A great camera for people not looking to break the bank. It has an impressive array of features and works with all EF lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Gempy

customer_reviews.title: First SLR
customer_reviews.text: First SLR camera. Couldn’t be happier. Excellent deal with the 18-55mm and 55-250mm lenses. Has been really fun learning to use this camera would definitely recommend for any beginner
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cooley

customer_reviews.title: Takes standard SD cards
customer_reviews.text: Having a blast learning with this terrific camera! One note: The Amazon specs say it takes micro SD cards. This is incorrect. It takes standard SD cards. Fortunately the micro SD card I bought came with an SD adapter too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera with lots and lots of features for a budding photographer
customer_reviews.author: wr-co

customer_reviews.title: Sunday delivered
customer_reviews.text: Got it delivered on 2 day shipping delivered on a Sunday . Amazon lockers come in handy. Comes with only strap no bag or memory only one battery 1-week so far so good no problems yet
customer_reviews.author: Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade From Canon T3i.
customer_reviews.text: I had the Canon T3i (which still works quite well) and wanted the new generation after reading raving reviews. Reviews were spot on, this is a great upgrade from a T3i and pictures are simply outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Contributor

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter - her first camera - amateur photography just for fun and she loves it. Pics are great and it’s easy to use. Can’t give you any other guru details :-)
customer_reviews.author: pagerc

customer_reviews.title: Did not turn on
customer_reviews.text: This item came to me and it seemed to have been opened. Then put the charged battery in turned it on and nothing. would not turn on. The only thing once i call they sent me another out while this is on its way back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful camera
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional photographer but I Do know my way around a camera. This canon EOS Rebel T7i is easy to use. Better last a long time The touch screen is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: nanaley

customer_reviews.title: Like the 80d's little brother who just won the science fair and you're jealous.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Wish it was weather sealed and had a faster shutter. Digital IS awesome but it crops in a bit. Really a great tool. Especially for a first camera/vlog setup. Went with the 80d though since the price dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: More features than my Xti. Great focus and photo quality.
customer_reviews.text: Still working on all the functions and how they differ from my XTi. I may take a little more time to learn where everything is and how to make it all work, Overall I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes amazing quality photos I did change the lens which helped too. The microphone did not work which why I removed some star. I contacted canon which didn’t help much either.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Dupree

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent picture quality. Fast shutter speeds so if you’re shooting wildlife or toddlers it takes good pictures. Only thing I’m not a fan of is that it’s somewhat cumbersome to take videos. Once you’re used to it it isn’t bad. Overall a great camera!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Bourgeois

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great for semipro
customer_reviews.text: Really good for the non professional photographer to appear as one.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Zeller

customer_reviews.title: Great quality camera.
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning to use this model, but so far I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: James Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Auto features have worked well
customer_reviews.text: So far, this camera has been great for this absolute beginner. While I'm giving it 5 Stars, be aware I have ONLY used it in auto settings at this point.
customer_reviews.author: An Aggie Wife

customer_reviews.title: Great videos, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great videos, and easy to use. I recommend buying a remote if recording yourself. Spend to extra money to buy the Canon remote. The Amazon remote isn't compatible with the Camera.
customer_reviews.author: Keith O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: So far this camera is working great. I upgraded from the XSi so it is a big leap in technology for me. It makes my 70-200mm L shine!
customer_reviews.author: Lenny from Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Less than 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: I loved the camera, but it lasted less than 6 months. Bummer. Buyer, beware.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Craig

customer_reviews.title: 100% satisfied. I I recommend it this cam to professional ...
customer_reviews.text: Excelente cam! 100% satisfied. I I recommend it this cam to professional but also to people who love Photography!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for beginners through advanced!
customer_reviews.text: The instructional interface is great for anyone just starting their photographic journey. I bought this as a slight upgrade from my t6 (until I can afford a full frame at least). Loving the range of focus points and the rotating screen as it's harder for me to get low as I get older! I have yet to try out the mic with any video but figured it was a nice accessory to have just in case.
customer_reviews.author: gael mazzella

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this from a T5 and definitely worth the investment. Camera is very refined, has an external microphone input, and takes amazing photos. Great camera for the “advanced beginner”
customer_reviews.author: Jose Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera everyday and I still love it! You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Brett Jones

customer_reviews.title: Canon EOS T7i
customer_reviews.text: Camera take great photos which I mostly take, but like the idea of being able to take videos in the same camera.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Already shooting amazing photos. I’m so happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: SaQuane Milton

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as photographed, arrived in the expected time frame (two days), and was packaged with lots of bubble wrap! I'm a huge Canon fan and this did not disappoint. Excited to use my new gear!
customer_reviews.author: ENN

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product!
customer_reviews.text: Love Canon products. I have continued to upgrade with Canon and have always been pleased.
customer_reviews.author: judy knapp

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera as I am an amateur photographer and LOVE taking pictures.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: T7I
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great! The quality of everything is beyond my expectations. The bundle pack is definitely worth the money (if you have it). Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: Auto focus can be better in my opinion I prefer manual focus but for beginners this camera is great
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Morales

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes beautiful pictures. It was a gift an she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Sunnie

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very good video quality, I use it to make YouTube videos and even the occasional video shoot it does exceptionally well.
customer_reviews.author: Jacolbi Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice and easy to operate. Take good quality picture.
customer_reviews.author: BlueEagle

customer_reviews.title: Canon EOS REBEL T7i Body Great Focusing
customer_reviews.text: Canon EOS REBEL T7i Body has a greatly improved focusing system. Compatible with all my EOS lens.
customer_reviews.author: Danny R Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for the amateur photographer
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a T6i and have not regretted it yet
customer_reviews.author: Robert R Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great Canon Quality
customer_reviews.text: Came Just like Brand New!! I was upgrading from my t3i and I’m so glad I chose this one over the Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Calipari

customer_reviews.title: Good for pictures and video!
customer_reviews.text: I got this in order to record videos but also to take pictures whenever I traveled anywhere or attended any special occasions. So far it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Huerta

customer_reviews.title: Canon always thumbs up!👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade from my Rebel SL1. Wifi and Bluetooth! Sweet to have 6 shots per second!
customer_reviews.author: KThis

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: So far we have been very impressed with this camera and all of its features. We have been loving it so much!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I’m still learning about it but everything I’ve seen so far has been good ... and this coming from a 16-year Nikon guy!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Carson

customer_reviews.title: Not a beginners camera
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use if you know what the icons represent...
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl J Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Beginners friendly
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Picture Quality, Bluetooth transfer of photos are very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Features!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera! I had a 10 yr. old Canon SLR. WiFi is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Learn how to use it
customer_reviews.text: I love it. You really have to learn how to use it in order for you to enjoy takimg photos
customer_reviews.author: Katt

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Photography requires a lot of money to buy a lens
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the EOS t3 since 2011, and this is SO far superior, starting with double the MP on the sensor, as well as some features once only found on more expensive models.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Clark

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had the original rebel which I always loved, but finally broke down and bought myself a new one. Once again Canon does't disappoint - it's awesome and easy to use. Also takes great pics!
customer_reviews.author: J. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Good, basic camera that doesn't really excel at anything ...
customer_reviews.text: Good, basic camera that doesn't really excel at anything but can do pretty much everything competently. Same sensor as the 80D, 77D, and SL2. The latter two also include the DIGIC7 image processor, just as the T7i does, whereas the former most only uses the DIGIC6. Big negative here is that it can't shoot in 4K in any capacity. Competitors like Panasonic are starting to include it in even their entry level cameras like the G7. No-10 bit even in 1080p.
customer_reviews.author: Hexxys

customer_reviews.title: Best beginner DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Best beginner DSLR. Only if it had 4k video recording it would be perfect. Cons: Not weather sealed No 4k video Pros: Awesome sensor In body stabilization Canon quality Great built in tutor "easy mode"
customer_reviews.author: Ren R.

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures
customer_reviews.text: I am having trouble with the WiFi connecting to my phone it worked great the first week and all of a sudden it won’t connect.
customer_reviews.author: loveyaleann

customer_reviews.title: Sweet upgrade from a T5i
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is an excellent upgrade from a Rebel T5i. I only have this camera for a few weeks but so far I love it.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

product_meta.title: Canon EOS Rebel T7i US 24.2 Digital SLR Camera with 3-Inch LCD, Black (1894C002)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:w/ 18-55mmStep up from a smartphone or compact camera and see the difference. With an optical viewfinder to see exactly what you'll capture, 45-point all cross-type AF for accurate results, dual pixel CMOS AF with Phase detection and more, the EOS Rebel t7i is one of the most advanced EOS rebels yet. Color Filter System: RGB primary color filters.
feature_bullets: Built in Wi Fi, NFC and Bluetooth Lens used: EF S 18 55 millimeter f/4 56 IS STM (at focal length of 55 millimeter)
High Speed continuous shooting at up to 60 fps Weight Approx 1877 ounce / 532 grams (including battery pack and SD memory card) Approx 1711 ounce / 485 gram (body only)
Metering Range: EV 1 20 (room temperature, ISO 100, evaluative metering)
Use the EOS Utility Webcam Beta Software (Mac and Windows) to turn your compatible Canon camera into a high-quality webcam
